Files Headings

main.js
¶

This is the main entry point of the game. We require Phaser as well as all of our states and add those states to the game.

Finally, we start the boot state which kicks off the game.

 
8
¶

Get a handle to Phaser! Note that the phaser lib is not actually part of this project anywhere. Instead, we're using the CDN copy of phaser via browserify-shim. You'll see a reference to the CDN copy in index.html

 
13  
14  var Phaser = require('phaser');
15  
16  
17
¶

Create a new instance of phaser

 
16  
17  var game = new Phaser.Game(480, 320, Phaser.AUTO, 'content', null);
18  
19  
20
¶

Bring in all of our states via require calls.

 
19  
20  var boot = require('./state/boot.js');
21  var preloader = require('./state/preloader');
22  var mainMenu = require('./state/mainMenu');
23  var level1 = require('./state/level1');
24  
25  
26  
27
¶

Add all of our states to the Phaser game instance.

 
26  
27  game.state.add('boot', boot, false);
28  game.state.add('preloader', preloader, false);
29  game.state.add('mainMenu', mainMenu, false);
30  game.state.add('level1', level1, false);
31  
32  
33
¶

Kick off the game by starting up the boot state

 
32  
33  game.state.start('boot');
34  
35
¶

See boot.js for the next step
